type.name: productName
type.help: ColdFusion product name, usually "ColdFusion Server"

type.name: productVersion
type.help: ColdFusion product release information. Comma seperated list of build numbers, first number is the major build number. Example: 7,0,1,116466

type.name: productLevel
type.help: ColdFusion product level information, for example: "Professional", "Enterprise", or "Developer"

type.name: serialNumber
type.help: ColdFusion serial number.

type.name: supportedLocales
type.help: Locales supported by ColdFusion, comma seperated.

type.name: expiration
type.help: Expiration date of ColdFusion.

type.name: rootDir
type.help: Directory ColdFusion is installed to Example: C:\CFusionMX7

type.name: appServer
type.help: Name of J2EE Application server, for stand-alone ColdFusion the value is "JRun4".

type.name: installKit
type.help: Type of installation method. Example: Native Windows

type.name: name
type.help: Server operating system name.

type.name: additionalInformation
type.help: Information about the host operating system.

type.name: version
type.help: Operating system version.

type.name: arch
type.help: The computer architecture, Windows computers are: x86

type.name: buildNumber
type.help: Build number of the host operating system.

type.name: applicationName
type.help: Name of the application set with the cfapplication tag, or in Application.cfc

type.name: Name
type.help: The application name. If you do not set this variable, or set it to the empty string, your CFC applies to the unnamed application scope, which is the ColdFusion MX J2EE servlet context.

type.name: ApplicationTimeout
type.help: Life span, as a real number of days, of the application, including all Application scope variables. Use the CFML CreateTimeSpan function to generate this variable's value.

type.name: ClientManagement
type.help: Whether the application supports Client scope variables.

type.name: ClientStorage
type.help: Where Client variables are stored; can be cookie, registry, or the name of a data source.

type.name: LoginStorage
type.help: Whether to store login information in the Cookie scope or the Session scope.

type.name: SessionManagement
type.help: Whether the application supports Session scope variables.

type.name: SessionTimeout
type.help: Life span, as a real number of days, of the user session, including all Session variables. Use the CFML CreateTimeSpan function to generate this variable's value.

type.name: SetClientCookies
type.help: Whether to send CFID and CFTOKEN cookies to the client browser.

type.name: SetDomainCookies
type.help: Whether to set CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not just a host).

type.name: ScriptProtect
type.help: Whether to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks.

type.name: cfid
type.help: Unique client ID. Part of the session key.

type.name: cftoken
type.help: Unique ID. Part of the session key.

type.name: hitCount
type.help: Number of client visits.

type.name: lastVisit
type.help: Date and time of the last visit.

type.name: timeCreated
type.help: Date and time of first visit.

type.name: urlToken
type.help: CFID combined with CFTOKEN. Example: CFID=123&CFTOKEN=45678

type.name: cfid
type.help: Unique Session ID. Part of the session key.

type.name: cftoken
type.help: Unique Session ID. Part of the session key.

type.name: urlToken
type.help: CFID combined with CFTOKEN Eexample: CFID=123&CFTOKEN=45678

type.name: sessionId
type.help: A unique identifier for the session. ColdFusion session management: a combination of the application name and CFID and CFToken values. J2EE session management: the jsessionid value.

type.name: executionMode
type.help: A custom tag template may be invoked in either of two modes: "Start" tag execution and "End" tag execution. "Inactive" is another possible value, but for unknown purposes.

type.name: hasEndTag
type.help: Used for code validation, it distinguishes between custom tags that have and don't have end tags for ExecutionMode='start'. The name of the Boolean value is ThisTagHasEndTag.

type.name: generatedContent
type.help: Custom tags can access and modify the generated content of any of its instances using the ThisTag.GeneratedContent variable.

type.name: assocAttribs
type.help: Holds the attributes of all nested tags if CFASSOCIATE has used them.

type.name: attemptedServerFile
type.help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion attempted to save a file.

type.name: clientDirectory
type.help: Full path of the uploaded file on the clients system.

type.name: clientFile
type.help: Filename of the uploaded file on the clients system.

type.name: clientFileExt
type.help: Extension of the uploaded file on the clients system without a period.

type.name: clientFileName
type.help: Filename without an extension of the uploaded file on the client's system.

type.name: contentSubType
type.help: MIME content subtype of the saved file.

type.name: contentType
type.help: MIME content type of the saved file.

type.name: dateLastAccessed
type.help: Date and time the uploaded file was last accessed.

type.name: fileExisted
type.help: Specifies whether or not the file already existed with the same path.

type.name: fileSize
type.help: Size of the uploaded file.

type.name: fileWasAppended
type.help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion appended a file to an existing file.

type.name: fileWasOverwritten
type.help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion overwrote a file.

type.name: fileWasRenamed
type.help: Specifies whether or not the uploaded file was renamed to avoid a name conflict.

type.name: fileWasSaved
type.help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion saved a file.

type.name: oldFileSize
type.help: Size of a file that was overwritten in the file upload operation.

type.name: serverDirectory
type.help: Full path of the file actually saved.

type.name: serverFile
type.help: Filename of the file actually saved.

type.name: serverFileExt
type.help: Extension of the uploaded file on the server, without a period Example: txt

type.name: serverFileName
type.help: Filename, without an extension, of the uploaded file on the server.

type.name: timeCreated
type.help: Time the uploaded file was created.

type.name: timeLastModified
type.help: Date and time of the last modification to the uploaded file.

type.name: returnValue
type.help: The result value depending on the action performed, as follows: getCurrentDir = current directory (string) getCurrentURL = current URL (string) existsDir = yes/no existsFile = yes/no exists = yes/no

type.name: succeeded
type.help: Yes or No dependent on value of ErrorCode.

type.name: errorCode
type.help: Error code.

type.name: errorText
type.help: Text associated with ErrorCode.

type.name: name
type.help: Filename of the current element.

type.name: path
type.help: File path (without the drive designation) of the current element.

type.name: url
type.help: Complete URL for the current element (file or directory).

type.name: length
type.help: Number indicating file size of the current element.

type.name: lastModified
type.help: Unformatted date/time value of the current element.

type.name: attributes
type.help: Indicates attributes of the current element.

type.name: isDirectory
type.help: Indicates whether object is a file or directory.

type.name: currentRow
type.help: The current row of the query in a loop.

type.name: recordCount
type.help: Total number of records in the query.

type.name: columnList
type.help: Column list, comma seperated.

type.name: auth
type.help: Whether the user is authenticated

type.name: groups
type.help: A comma-delimited list of the user's groups in the specified domain. The structure includes this field only if the listGroups attribute is Yes.

type.name: name
type.help: The user name; equals the tag's name attribute.

type.name: status
type.help: The authentication status. One of the following: - success - UserNotInDirFailure: the user is not listed in the directory. - AuthenticationFailure: the user is in the directory, but the password is not valid.

type.name: attributes
type.help: Returns file attributes, if applicable.

type.name: dateLastModified
type.help: Returns the date an entry was last modified.

type.name: mode
type.help: (Deprecated) Empty value for backward compatibility with ColdFusion 5 on UNIX.

type.name: directory
type.help: Directory containing the entry.

type.name: name
type.help: Returns the directory or file entry name. ( "." and ".." aren't returned since 6.0)

type.name: size
type.help: Returns the size of directory or file entry.

type.name: type
type.help: Returns entry type: "File" or "Dir".

type.name: currentRow
type.help: The current row of the query in a loop.

type.name: recordCount
type.help: Total number of records in the query.

type.name: columnList
type.help: Column list, comma seperated.

type.name: entry
type.help: Registry value name.

type.name: type
type.help: Data type.

type.name: value
type.help: Registry value data.

type.name: currentRow
type.help: The current row of the query in a loop.

type.name: recordCount
type.help: Total number of records in the query.

type.name: columnList
type.help: Column list, comma seperated.

type.name: url
type.help: Value of URLpath attribute in the cfindex tag used to populate a collection.

type.name: key
type.help: Value of the key attribute in the cfindex tag used to populate a collection.

type.name: title
type.help: Value of title attribute in cfindex tag used to populate the collection, including PDF and Office document titles. If a title is not extracted from the document, the tag uses the cfindex title attribute value for each row.

type.name: score
type.help: Relevancy score of document based on search criteria, from 0-1. Example: 0.92 (would be 92%)

type.name: custom1
type.help: Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.

type.name: custom2
type.help: Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.

type.name: custom3
type.help: Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.

type.name: custom4
type.help: Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.

type.name: context
type.help: A context summary containing the search terms, highlighted in bold (by default). This is enabled if you set the contextpassages attribute to a number greater than zero.

type.name: size
type.help: The number of bytes in the index document.

type.name: rank
type.help: The rank of this document in the search results.

type.name: author
type.help: Extracted from the HTML, Office, and PDF documents when available.

type.name: type
type.help: The MIME type of the document. Example: text/html

type.name: category
type.help: A list of the categories that were specified for this document when it was indexed.

type.name: categoryTree
type.help: A hierarchical category tree, or serial list of categories, that was specified for this document when it was indexed. Only a single tree is returned.

type.name: recordsSearched
type.help: Number of records searched. This is the same value for each row in the record set. Corresponds to the searched key in the status structure.

type.name: summary
type.help: Contents of automatic summary generated by cfindex.

type.name: currentRow
type.help: The current row of the query in a loop.

type.name: recordCount
type.help: Total number of records in the query.

type.name: columnList
type.help: Column list, comma seperated.

type.name: categories
type.help: Collection has category support enabled or disabled.

type.name: charset
type.help: The character set of the collection.

type.name: created
type.help: The date and time that the collection was created.

type.name: doccount
type.help: The number of documents in this collection.

type.name: external
type.help: - yes: the collection is external. - no: the collection is not external. - Not Found: the collection is registered but is not available in the defined path .

type.name: language
type.help: The locale setting of the collection. (This information is not available for K2Server collections.)

type.name: lastModified
type.help: The date and time that the collection was last changed.

type.name: name
type.help: The name of the collection.

type.name: path
type.help: Absolute path to the collection.

type.name: size
type.help: The size of the collection, expressed in kilobytes.

type.name: mapped
type.help: Obsolete. The collection is mapped. (This information is not available for K2Server collections.)

type.name: online
type.help: Obsolete. The collection can be searched. (If EXTERNAL = "Not Found", this value is "No".)

type.name: registered
type.help: Obsolete. - CF: collection is registered by ColdFusion - K2: collection is registered by K2Server

type.name: statusCode
type.help: Status code for the stored procedure. (only when returnCode="true")

type.name: executionTime
type.help: Execution time for the request in milliseconds. (only when returnCode="true")

type.name: attachments
type.help: Contains a tab-separated list of all original attachment names. (only when action="getall")

type.name: attachmentFiles
type.help: Contains a tab-separated list of the actual temporary filenames written to the server. (only when action="getall")

type.name: body
type.help: Body of message. (only when action="getall")

type.name: textBody
type.help: Text Body of message. (only when action="getall")

type.name: htmlBody
type.help: HTML Body of message. (only when action="getall")

type.name: cc
type.help: CC value from message header.

type.name: date
type.help: Date sent value from message header.

type.name: from
type.help: From value from message header.

type.name: header
type.help: Entire message header. (only when action="getall")

type.name: messageNumber
type.help: Sequential message number of message on POP server.

type.name: messageID
type.help: The mail header Message-ID field.

type.name: replyTo
type.help: ReplyTo value from message header.

type.name: subject
type.help: Subject value from message header.

type.name: to
type.help: To value from message header.

type.name: columnList
type.help: Column list, comma seperated.

type.name: currentRow
type.help: The current row of the query in a loop.

type.name: recordCount
type.help: Total number of records in the query.

type.name: uid
type.help: Unique identifier for the e-mail message file. (mail header X-UID field)

type.name: cids
type.help: Structure that contains key-value pairs. The keys are the names of image files that are embedded in the e-mail message; the values are their cids. You can use the cid to find the correct place of an image in an HTML e-mail message that the cfpop tag retrieves. If the e-mail message contains more than one embedded image, only the last embedded image is available.

type.name: sql
type.help: The SQL statement that was executed.

type.name: cached
type.help: If the query was cached.

type.name: sqlParameters
type.help: An ordered Array of cfqueryparam values.

type.name: recordCount
type.help: Total number of records in the query.

type.name: columnList
type.help: Column list, comma seperated.

type.name: executionTime
type.help: Execution time for the SQL request.

type.name: currentRow
type.help: The current row of the query in a loop.

type.name: recordCount
type.help: Total number of records in the query.

type.name: columnList
type.help: Column list, comma seperated.

type.name: charSet
type.help: Response character character set (character encoding) specified by the response Content-Type header.

type.name: errorDetail
type.help: If the connection to the HTTP server fails, contains details about the failure. For instance: "Unknown host: my.co.com"; otherwise, the empty string. Macromedia recommends that you check this variable for an error condition before checking other variables.

type.name: fileContent
type.help: Response body; for example: the contents of a html page retrieved by a GET operation. Empty if you save the response in a file.

type.name: header
type.help: Raw response header containing all header information in a single string. Contains the same information as the #cfhttp.responseHeader# variable.

type.name: mimeType
type.help: MIME type specified by the response Content-Type header, Example: text/html

type.name: responseHeader
type.help: The response headers formatted into a structure. Each element key is the header name, such as Content-Type or Status_Code. If there is more than one instance of a header type, the type values are put in an array. One common technique is to dynamically access the cfhttp.responseHeader structure as a dynamic array, example: #cfhttp.resonseHeader[fieldVariable]#

type.name: statusCode
type.help: The HTTP status_code header value followed by the HTTP Explanation header value. Example: 200 OK

type.name: text
type.help: Boolean; True if the response body content type is text. ColdFusion recognizes the response body as text if: The header does not specify a content type, or it starts with "text" or "message" or the full content type="application/octet-stream".

type.name: ALL_HTTP
type.help: All HTTP headers that were not already parsed into one of the listed variables. These variables are of the form HTTP_header field name with each variable separated by a semi-colon

type.name: ALL_RAW
type.help: (IIS) Retrieves all headers in raw form. The difference between CGI.ALL_RAW and CGI.ALL_HTTP is that CGI.ALL_HTTP places an HTTP_ prefix before the header name and the header name is always capitalized. In ALL_RAW the header name and values appear as they are sent by the client.

type.name: APP_POOL_ID
type.help: (IIS) Returns the name of the application pool that is running in the IIS worker process that is handling the request. There is also an CGI.APP_POOL_ID environment variable that is available to applications that are running in the IIS worker process. (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)

type.name: APPL_MD_PATH
type.help: (IIS) Retrieves the metabase path of the application.

type.name: APPL_PHYSICAL_PATH
type.help: (IIS) Retrieves the physical path corresponding to the metabase path in CGI.APPL_MD_PATH.

type.name: AUTH_PASSWORD
type.help: (IIS) The value entered in the client's authentication dialog. This variable is available only if Basic authentication is used.

type.name: AUTH_TYPE
type.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, this is the protocol-specific authentication method used to validate the user.

type.name: AUTH_USER
type.help: (IIS) The name of the user as it is derived from the authorization header sent by the client, before the user name is mapped to a Windows account. This variable is no different from CGI.REMOTE_USER. If you have an authentication filter installed on your Web server that maps incoming users to accounts, use CGI.LOGON_USER to view the mapped user name.

type.name: CACHE_URL
type.help: (IIS) Returns the full URL Example: http://www.macromedia.com:80/index.cfm?query=string (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)

type.name: CERT_COOKIE
type.help: (IIS) Unique ID for the client certificate, returned as a string. This can be used as a signature for the whole client certificate.

type.name: CERT_FLAGS
type.help: (IIS) bit0 is set to 1 if the client certificate is present. bit1 is set to 1 if the certification authority of the client certificate is invalid (that is, it is not in the list of recognized certification authorities on the server). If bit 1 of CGI.CERT_FLAGS is set to 1, indicating that the certificate is invalid, IIS version 4.0 and later will reject the certificate. (Note: Earlier versions of IIS will not reject the certificate.)

type.name: CERT_ISSUER
type.help: Issuer field of the client certificate (O=MS, OU=IAS, CN=user name, C=USA).

type.name: CERT_KEYSIZE
type.help: (IIS) Number of bits in the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection key size. Example: 128

type.name: CERT_SECRETKEYSIZE
type.help: (IIS) Number of bits in server certificate private key. Example: 1024

type.name: CERT_SERIALNUMBER
type.help: (IIS) Serial number field of the client certificate.

type.name: CERT_SERVER_ISSUER
type.help: (IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.

type.name: CERT_SERVER_SUBJECT
type.help: (IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.

type.name: CERT_SUBJECT
type.help: Subject field of the client certificate.

type.name: CF_TEMPLATE_PATH
type.help: Show the entire file path to the coldfusion template, similar to CGI.PATH_TRANSLATED. Example: c:\inetpub\wwwroot\somesite\somepage.cfm

type.name: CONTENT_LENGTH
type.help: The length of the content as given by the client.

type.name: CONTENT_TYPE
type.help: For queries that have attached information, such as HTTP POST and PUT, this is the content type of the data.

type.name: DATE_GMT
type.help: (Apache SSI) The current date and time in Greenwich Mean Time (now Unviversal Co-ordinated Time (UCT) in the default or #config defined format). Thursday, 03-May-2001 21:18:54 GMT

type.name: DATE_LOCAL
type.help: (Apache SSI) The current date and time in the local (server) timezone (in the default or #config defined format), Example: Thursday, 03-May-2001 17:18:54 EDT

type.name: DOCUMENT_ARGS
type.help: (Zeus SSI) This will be set to the CGI.QUERY_STRING of the master document. The value of CGI.QUERY_STRING for an SSI sub-request will contain the query string in the sub-request URL, if present, else the master document's CGI.QUERY_STRING.

type.name: DOCUMENT_NAME
type.help: (Apache SSI) The file name (excludes directories) of the document requested by the user. Example: ssi.htm

type.name: DOCUMENT_PATH_INFO
type.help: (Apache SSI/Zeus SSI) This will be set to the CGI.PATH_INFO of the master document.

type.name: DOCUMENT_ROOT
type.help: (Apache SSI) The root directory of this site defined by the 'DocumentRoot' directive in the General Section or a <virtualhost> section. Example: /var/www/zytrax

type.name: DOCUMENT_URI
type.help: (Apache SSI/Zeus SSI) The URL path of the document requested by the user. Example: /tech/web/ssi.htm

type.name: GATEWAY_INTERFACE
type.help: The revision of the CGI specification to which this server complies. Format: CGI/revision.

type.name: HTTP_ACCEPT
type.help: List of Content-types the browser can accept (defined by the HTTP Accept header).

type.name: HTTP_ACCEPT_ENCODING
type.help: (IIS) Returns a list of accepted encoding types. Example: gzip, deflate

type.name: HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE
type.help: (IIS) Returns a string describing the language to use for displaying content.

type.name: HTTP_CONNECTION
type.help: (IIS) Returns a string describing the connection type. Example: Keep-Alive

type.name: HTTP_COOKIE
type.help: (IIS) Returns the cookie string that was included with the request.

type.name: HTTP_HOST
type.help: (IIS) Returns the name of the Web server. This may or may not be the same as CGI.SERVER_NAME depending on type of name resolution you are using on your Web server (IP address, host header).

type.name: HTTP_METHOD
type.help: (IIS) The method used to make the request (Note: same as CGI.REQUEST_METHOD).

type.name: HTTP_REFERER
type.help: The referring document. The document that linked to or submitted form data.

type.name: HTTP_URL
type.help: (IIS) Returns the raw, encoded URL. Example: /vdir/default.asp?querystring

type.name: HTTP_USER_AGENT
type.help: The browser the client is currently using to send the request. Format: software/version library/version.

type.name: HTTP_VERSION
type.help: (IIS) The name and version of the request protocol (the raw form of CGI.SERVER_PROTOCOL).

type.name: HTTPS
type.help: (IIS/Zeus) Returns ON if the request came in through a secure channel; or it returns OFF, if the request is for an insecure channel. Example: SSL

type.name: HTTPS_KEYSIZE
type.help: (IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the SSL connection key size. Example: 128

type.name: HTTPS_SECRETKEYSIZE
type.help: (IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the server certificate private key. Example: 1024

type.name: HTTPS_SERVER_ISSUER
type.help: (IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.

type.name: HTTPS_SERVER_SUBJECT
type.help: (IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.

type.name: HTTPS_SESSIONID
type.help: (Zeus SSI) The value of the session id used by the SSL session. This value is unique for each distinct SSL session

type.name: INSTANCE_ID
type.help: (IIS) The ID for the IIS instance in textual format. If the instance ID is 1, it appears as a string. You can use this variable to retrieve the ID of the Web server instance (in the metabase) to which the request belongs.

type.name: INSTANCE_META_PATH
type.help: (IIS) The metabase path for the instance of IIS that responds to the request.

type.name: LAST_MODIFIED
type.help: (Apache SSI) The last modification date of the document (file) requested by the user (in the default or #config defined format). This variable related to the file currently being accessed i.e. if you put this is an included 'footer' file is is the modification date of the footer NOT the base document (you need to use a simple 'wheeze' to pass a USER variable which contains the calling documents modification date (see here). Example: Thursday, 03-May-2001 17:18:45 EDT

type.name: LOCAL_ADDR
type.help: (IIS) Returns the server address on which the request came in. This is important on computers where there can be multiple IP addresses bound to the computer, and you want to find out which address the request used.

type.name: LOGON_USER
type.help: (IIS) The Windows account that the user is impersonating while connected to your Web server. Use CGI.REMOTE_USER, CGI.UNMAPPED_REMOTE_USER, or CGI.AUTH_USER to view the raw user name that is contained in the request header. The only time CGI.LOGON_USER holds a different value than these other variables is if you have an authentication filter installed.

type.name: PATH
type.help: (Apache) The PATH(s) available to the server for this web site Example: /sbin:/usr/sbin:/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/X11R6/bin

type.name: PATH_INFO
type.help: The extra path information, as given by the client. In other words, scripts can be accessed by their virtual pathname, followed by extra information at the end of this path. The extra information is sent as CGI.PATH_INFO.

type.name: PATH_TRANSLATED
type.help: The server provides a translated version of CGI.PATH_INFO, which takes the path and does any virtual-to-physical mapping to it.

type.name: QUERY_STRING
type.help: The query information that follows the ? in the URL that referenced this script.

type.name: REMOTE_ADDR
type.help: The IP address of the remote host making the request.

type.name: REMOTE_HOST
type.help: The hostname making the request. If the server does not have this information, it sets CGI.REMOTE_ADDR and leaves this unset.

type.name: REMOTE_IDENT
type.help: If the HTTP server supports RFC 931 identification, then this variable is set to the remote user name retrieved from the server. Usage of this variable should be limited to logging only.

type.name: REMOTE_PORT
type.help: (IIS) The client port number of the TCP connection.

type.name: REMOTE_USER
type.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, this is the username they have authenticated as. (Also available as CGI.AUTH_USER.)

type.name: REQUEST_BODY
type.help: The entity body (if any) sent with an HTTP request or response is in a format and encoding defined by the Entity-Header fields. See the HTTP protocol specification for details.

type.name: REQUEST_METHOD
type.help: The method with which the request was made. For HTTP, this "GET", "HEAD", "POST", etc.

type.name: REQUEST_URI
type.help: (Apache) The URI for this request (relative to CGI.DOCUMENT_ROOT) Example: /tech/web/ssi.htm

type.name: SCRIPT_FILENAME
type.help: (Apache) The path to the script being executed (relative to CGI.DOCUMENT_ROOT) Example: /tech/web/ssi.htm

type.name: SCRIPT_NAME
type.help: A virtual path to the script being executed, used for self-referencing URLs.

type.name: SCRIPT_TRANSLATED
type.help: (IIS) The canonical physical path to the script listed in CGI.SCRIPT_NAME Example: \\?\c:\inetpub\wwwroot\vdir\default.asp (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)

type.name: SERVER_ADMIN
type.help: (Apache) The administrators e-mail address for this CGI.SERVER_NAME. Example: webmaster@zytrax.com

type.name: SERVER_NAME
type.help: The servers hostname, DNS alias, or IP address as it appears in self-referencing URLs.

type.name: SERVER_PORT
type.help: The port number to which the request was sent.

type.name: SERVER_PORT_SECURE
type.help: (IIS) A string that contains either 0 or 1. If the request is being handled on the secure port, then this is 1. Otherwise, it is 0.

type.name: SERVER_PROTOCOL
type.help: The name and revision of the information protocol this request came in with. Format: protocol/revision.

type.name: SERVER_SIGNATURE
type.help: (Apache) The HTML string that may be embedded in the page to identify this host. Example: <address>Apache/1.3.14 Server at www.zytrax.com Port 80</address>

type.name: SERVER_SOFTWARE
type.help: The name and version of the information server software answering the request (and running the gateway). Format: name/version.

type.name: SSI_EXEC_DISABLED
type.help: (IIS) Returns a 1 if the server-side include directive, #exec, is disabled. Otherwise, CGI.SSI_EXE_DISABLED returns a 0. To enable or disable #exec, use the SSIExecDisablemetabase property. (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)

type.name: UNENCODED_URL
type.help: (IIS) Returns the raw, unencoded URL Example: /vdir/default.asp?querystring (Note: IIS 4.0 and earlier: This server variable is not available)

type.name: UNMAPPED_REMOTE_USER
type.help: (IIS) The name of the user as it is derived from the authorization header sent by the client, before the user name is mapped to a Windows account (same as CGI.REMOTE_USER). If you have an authentication filter installed on your Web server that maps incoming users to accounts, use CGI.LOGON_USER to view the mapped user name.

type.name: URL
type.help: (IIS) Gives the base portion of the URL, without any querystring or extra path information. For the raw URL, use CGI.HTTP_URL or CGI.UNENCODED_URL. Example: "/vdir/default.asp".

type.name: URL_PATH_INFO
type.help: (IIS) Use CGI.PATH_INFO instead. (Note: This server variable is only available on IIS 5.0.)

type.name: USER_NAME
type.help: (Apache SSI) The user name of the web site in which this web site runs. Example: zytrax

type.name: type
type.help: The exception's type, possible values: Application, Database, Template, Security, Object, MissingInclude, Expression, Lock, SearchEngine or a Custom Type.

type.name: detail
type.help: A detailed message from the CFML compiler. This message, which can contain HTML formatting, can help to determine which tag threw the exception.

type.name: errorCode
type.help: The cfthrow tag can supply a value for this code through the errorCode attribute. For Type="Database", CFCATCH.ErrorCode has the same value as CFCATCH.SQLState. Otherwise, the value of CFCATCH.ErrorCode is the empty string.

type.name: extendedInfo
type.help: Custom error message information. This is returned only to CFCATCH tags for which the type attribute is "Application" or a custom type. Otherwise, the value of CFCATCH.ExtendedInfo is empty.

type.name: message
type.help: The exception's default diagnostic message, if one was provided. If no diagnostic message is available, this is empty.

type.name: errNumber
type.help: An internal expression error number. Available for expression exceptions.

type.name: lockName
type.help: The name of the affected lock. This is set to "anonymous" if the lock name is unknown. Available for locking exceptions.

type.name: lockOperation
type.help: The operation that failed. This is set to "unknown" if the failed operation is unknown. Available for locking exceptions.

type.name: missingFileName
type.help: The name of the missing file. Available for missingInclude exceptions.

type.name: nativeErrorCode
type.help: The native error code associated with this exception. Database drivers typically provide error codes to assist in the diagnosis of failing database operations. The values assumed by CFCATCH.NativeErrorCode are driver-dependent. If no error code is provided, the value of CFCATCH.nativeErrorCode is -1. The value is 0 for queries of queries. Available for database exceptions.

type.name: sqlState
type.help: The SQLState code associated with this exception. Database drivers typically provide error codes to assist in the diagnosis of failing database operations. SQLState codes are more consistent across database systems than native error codes. If the driver does not provide an SQLState value, the value of CFCATCH.SQLState is -1. Available for database exceptions.

type.name: sql
type.help: The SQL statement sent to the data source. Available for database exceptions.

type.name: queryError
type.help: The error message as reported by the database driver. Available for database exceptions.

type.name: where
type.help: If the query uses the cfqueryparam tag, query parameter name-value pairs. Available for database exceptions.

type.name: tagContext
type.help: Array of tag information structures.

type.name: column
type.help: Obsolete. (retained for backwards compatibility). Always 0.

type.name: id
type.help: The tag in which the exception occurred. Exceptions in CFScript are indicated by two question marks (??). All custom tags, including those called directly, are identified as cfmodule.

type.name: line
type.help: The line on the page in which the tag is located.

type.name: raw_trace
type.help: The raw Java stack trace for the error.

type.name: template
type.help: The pathname of the application page that contains the tag.

type.name: type
type.help: The type of page; it is always a ColdFusion page.

type.name: invalidFields
type.help: Unordered list of validation errors that occurred. This includes any text that you specify in the value attribute or a hidden tag used to validate form input. Available for Validation type errors.

type.name: validationHeader
type.help: Text for the header of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.

type.name: validationFooter
type.help: Text for the footer of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.

type.name: browser
type.help: Browser that was running when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: dateTime
type.help: Date and time when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: diagnostics
type.help: Detailed error diagnostics. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: generatedContent
type.help: Any content that ColdFusion generated in response to the request prior to the error. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: httpReferer
type.help: Page containing the HTML link to the page on which the error occurred. This value is an empty string if the user specified the page directly in the browser. (string). Available for Exception and Request type errors

type.name: mailTo
type.help: E-mail address of the administrator who should be notified. This value is set in the mailTo attribute of the cferror tag. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: queryString
type.help: URL query string of the client's request, if any. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: remoteAddress
type.help: IP address of the remote client. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: template
type.help: Page being executed when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

type.name: message
type.help: Error message associated with the exception. Available for Exception type errors.

type.name: rootCause
type.help: Java servlet exception reported by the JVM as the cause of the "root cause" of the exception. Available for Exception type errors.

type.name: type
type.help: Exception type, possible values: Application, Database, Template, Security, Object, MissingInclude, Expression, Lock, SearchEngine or a Custom Type.

type.name: tagContext
type.help: Array of structures containing information for each tag in the tag stack The tag stack consists of each tag that is currently open. Available for Exception type errors.

type.name: column
type.help: Obsolete. (retained for backwards compatibility). Always 0.

type.name: id
type.help: The tag in which the exception occurred. Exceptions in CFScript are indicated by two question marks (??). All custom tags, including those called directly, are identified as cfmodule.

type.name: line
type.help: The line on the page in which the tag is located.

type.name: raw_trace
type.help: The raw Java stack trace for the error.

type.name: template
type.help: The pathname of the application page that contains the tag.

type.name: type
type.help: The type of page; it is always a ColdFusion page.
